nodes.text: Gold Leader
Gold Leader or Gold One was the call sign of the Commander of Gold Squadron. There were a number of starfighter squadrons with this name, and several pilots went by the call sign Gold Leader.
History
Galactic Republic
During the Battle of Muunilinst in 22 BBY, a Gold Leader was commanding Gold Squadron. He was killed by incoming Geonosian starfighters.
Anakin Skywalker had the call sign Gold Leader during the Battle of Bothawui.
During the Battle of Boz Pity, Jedi General Saesee Tiin commanded Gold Squadron.
Rebel Alliance
The call sign was used by Jon "Dutch" Vander when he flew with the Rebel Alliance's Gold Squadron during the Battle of Yavin. Vander was killed in the assault against the Death Star.
Crix Madine served as Gold Leader[source?] during the Liberation of Gerrard V in 1 ABY.
Lando Calrissian was Gold Leader during the Battle of Endor while commanding Gold Squadron, the group that assaulted and destroyed the second Death Star.

When Gold Squadron—without Calrissian—joined the Rebel Bakura task force during the planet's invasion by the Ssi-ruuvi Imperium shortly after the Alliance's victory at Endor, another Gold Leader led the squadron against a Ssi-ruuvi Wurrif-class light cruiser, destroying several of the Imperium's Swarm-class battle droids in the process.
Alliance of Free Planets
Calrissian also served as Gold Leader during the Second Battle of Endor. There the Alliance repelled the Nagai fighter squadrons led by Lumiya.
New Republic
During a simulation exercise to qualify for Wedge Antilles's new squadron, Kell Tainer used the callsign of Gold One.
Behind the scenes
In the Rogue Squadron series of games, Gold Leader was the name of an unlockable field rank, accessed when gaining 61-70 points.
